column3: Indicates whether the processing comprises of systematic monitoring of data subjects or their personal data
Indicates whether the processing ir part of or results in evaluation or scoring of an individual or their personal data
Indicates whether the processing comprises of matching or combining existing data
column9: originating from two or more data processing operations performed for different purposes and/or by different data controllers in a way that would exceed the reasonable expectations of the data subject (WP29 Opinion on Purpose limitation 13/EN WP 203, p.24).  For instance Integration/Enrichment with other data (not necessarily personal only)

column3: Indicates whether the processing comprises of or is part of or results in automated decision making
Indicates the processing is carried out at large scale in terms of size of data or individuals associated

column2: involves innovative use of new solutions
column3: Indicates the processing comprises of innovative uses of new or radical solutions
column9: e.g. combining fingerprint & face scan for access control. What is concidered new/innovative is of course subject to change over time.

column3: Indicates the source or origin of data being processed
column14: Georg P. Krog, Paul Ryan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit

column3: Indicates the logic used in processing such as for automated decision making
column14: Georg P. Krog, Paul Ryan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit

column3: Indicates consequences of processing such as those for Data Subjects in relation to automated decision making
column14: Georg P. Krog, Paul Ryan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit

column3: Indicates Involvement of humans in processing such as within automated decision making process
column9: Human involvement is also relevant to 'human in the loop'
column14: Georg P. Krog, Paul Ryan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit
